summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 between employees of T&M Protection Resources discussing an investigation into harassing emails sent to Mark Epstein (Jeffrey Epstein's brother) and a missing YouTube video link. The chain involves cybersecurity analysis of the emails and mentions a video featuring Jeff Epstein and Steve Bannon.

persons.name: Richard Frankel
persons.role: Attorney / Executive at T&M Protection Resources
persons.context: Appears as the primary recipient and sender in the email chain, coordinating the investigation into harassing emails sent to Mark Epstein and scheduling a meeting regarding 'Epstein'.

persons.name: Jose
persons.context: Addressed by Richard Frankel, appears to be a colleague who is being updated about arrival times and forwarded information about Mark Epstein.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.role: Subject of Investigation / Jeffrey Epstein's brother
persons.context: The brother of Jeffrey Epstein who is reported to be receiving harassing emails. He provided the original emails for analysis and is searching for a missing YouTube video link sent by 'Jeff'.

persons.name: William Barry
persons.role: Cyber Security Analyst at T&M Protection Resources
persons.context: Analyzed the header information from harassing emails sent to Mark Epstein, finding they routed through UK Yahoo servers. He attached the analysis and email copies.

persons.name: Simon Ragona
persons.role: Managing Director of Cybersecurity at T&M Protection Resources
persons.context: Summarized the investigation, stating contact was made with Mark Epstein to obtain original emails. He discussed the missing YouTube video link that was sent by 'Jeff' to Mark.

persons.name: William Weller
persons.context: Received the analysis and email attachments from William Barry, as indicated in the 'To' field of an internal email.

persons.name: Steven Petronio
persons.context: Was copied on the internal T&M Protection Resources email discussing the analysis of the harassing emails sent to Mark Epstein.

persons.name: Jeff
persons.context: Referenced as the person who sent Mark Epstein an email containing a YouTube link to a 'mock interview' between himself and Steve Bannon. Implied to be Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Steve Bannon
persons.context: Was featured in a YouTube 'mock interview' with Jeff (Epstein), which was sent to Mark Epstein. The video contained comments about Trump and their relationship.

connections.description: Mark Epstein is the brother of Jeff (Jeffrey Epstein), who sent him a YouTube video link.
A YouTube video featured a 'mock interview' between Jeff Epstein and Steve Bannon, discussing Trump and their relationship.
Richard Frankel, through T&M Protection Resources, is investigating harassing emails sent to his client, Mark Epstein.
Both are cybersecurity professionals at T&M Protection Resources collaborating on the analysis of emails sent to Mark Epstein.

events.title: Harassing Emails Analysis
events.description: William Barry completes analysis of harassing emails sent to Mark Epstein, finding they route through UK Yahoo servers.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting Regarding Epstein
events.description: Richard Frankel schedules a meeting for 9:30 AM regarding 'Epstein', likely concerning the investigation into the harassing emails.

events.title: YouTube Video Sent to Mark Epstein
events.description: Jeff (Epstein) sends Mark Epstein an email with a YouTube link to a 'mock interview' between Jeff and Steve Bannon. The video is later taken down.

locations: 230 Park Avenue, Suite 440, New York, NY 10169 (T&M Protection Resources office)
keyFacts: Mark Epstein, Jeffrey Epstein's brother, was receiving harassing emails in August 2019, prompting an investigation by T&M Protection Resources.
A cybersecurity analysis found the harassing emails were routed through UK Yahoo email servers.

Mark Epstein had previously received an email from his brother Jeff containing a YouTube link to a 'mock interview' between Jeff Epstein and Steve Bannon, which discussed Trump and their relationship.
The YouTube video was sent 3-4 months prior to August 2019 and was later taken down, with Mark Epstein unable to relocate the original email or link.
The email chain shows ongoing security and investigative work for the Epstein family following Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and death.
